fields.description:
The following things need to be done:

* Add new property to studio.properties called studio.enforce.ssl
* Write upgrade task for each application that, if the above is false (default will be false if not found), will change the applications base url, and all the applink instances in the application from https to http links
* Any customers that currently want https, before upgrading to 1.2.3, should have a studio home directory created, with studio.properties prepopulated and studio.enforce.ssl set to true
fields.summary: Create upgrade task to convert users to use HTTP

fields.description:
I believe there is a problem with the scoping for the JSESSIONID cookie issued when visiting /wiki, please consult the http dump below

Request 1:
{code}
URL: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/dashboard.action
Host: studio.atlassian.com
IP: 207.223.243.40
Location: Saint Louis, MO*
Error/Status Code: 200
Start Offset: 0.593 s
DNS Lookup: 95 ms
Initial Connection: 84 ms
SSL Negotiation: 413 ms
Time to First Byte: 445 ms
Content Download: 416 ms
Bytes In (downloaded): 43.6 KB
Bytes Out (uploaded): 0.8 KB
Request Headers:

GET /wiki/dashboard.action HTTP/1.1
Accept: image/gif, image/x-xbitmap, image/jpeg, image/pjpeg, application/x-shockwave-flash, application/xaml+xml, application/vnd.ms-xpsdocument, application/x-ms-xbap, application/x-ms-application, application/x-silverlight, */*
Accept-Language: en-us
UA-CPU: x86
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 5.1; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.30; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.648)
Host: studio.atlassian.com
Connection: Keep-Alive
Response Headers:

HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Date: Tue, 26 Aug 2008 00:20:47 GMT
Server: Apache/2.2.3 (CentOS)
Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
X-Confluence-Request-Time: 1219710047663
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=CBBD6480F3D818BECC559360E12E70CA; Path=/wiki; Secure
Set-Cookie: studio.project.rec.used.cookie=; Expires=Wed, 26-Aug-2009 00:20:47 GMT; Path=/
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
{code}

At the end of this request , a cookie for JSESSIONID=CBBD6480F3D818BECC559360E12E70CA, is set with the path /wiki

Request 2:

{code}
URL: https://studio.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/dynamiccss/studio-colors-css.css
Host: studio.atlassian.com
IP: 207.223.243.40
Location: Saint Louis, MO*
Error/Status Code: 200
Start Offset: 1.457 s
Initial Connection: 114 ms
SSL Negotiation: 187 ms
Time to First Byte: 113 ms
Content Download: 0 ms
Bytes In (downloaded): 0.9 KB
Bytes Out (uploaded): 0.6 KB
Request Headers:

GET /plugins/servlet/applinks/dynamiccss/studio-colors-css.css HTTP/1.1
Accept: */*
Referer: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/dashboard.action
Accept-Language: en-us
UA-CPU: x86
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 5.1; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.30; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.648)
Host: studio.atlassian.com
Connection: Keep-Alive
Cookie: studio.project.rec.used.cookie=
Response Headers:

HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Date: Tue, 26 Aug 2008 00:20:48 GMT
Server: Apache/2.2.3 (CentOS)
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=42F71BE063C754BA92EEA1AA8457A50A; Path=/; Secure
ETag: 275
Cache-Control: max-age=300, must-revalidate
Vary: User-Agent
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/css;charset=UTF-8
{code}

The next file included has the URL /plugins, so this does not match the previous cookie set on wiki, so is not returned by the browser. The app, sensing this, creates a new JSESSIONID and assigns it the path /

Request 3:

{code}
URL: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/s/1415/1/1.0/_/download/resources/confluence.web.resources:master-styles/master.css
Host: studio.atlassian.com
IP: 207.223.243.40
Location: Saint Louis, MO*
Error/Status Code: 200
Start Offset: 1.755 s
Initial Connection: 83 ms
SSL Negotiation: 93 ms
Time to First Byte: 124 ms
Content Download: 526 ms
Bytes In (downloaded): 34.5 KB
Bytes Out (uploaded): 0.7 KB
Request Headers:

GET /wiki/s/1415/1/1.0/_/download/resources/confluence.web.resources:master-styles/master.css HTTP/1.1
Accept: */*
Referer: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/dashboard.action
Accept-Language: en-us
UA-CPU: x86
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 5.1; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.30; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.648)
Host: studio.atlassian.com
Connection: Keep-Alive
Cookie: JSESSIONID=CBBD6480F3D818BECC559360E12E70CA; studio.project.rec.used.cookie=; JSESSIONID=42F71BE063C754BA92EEA1AA8457A50A
Response Headers:

HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Date: Tue, 26 Aug 2008 00:20:48 GMT
Server: Apache/2.2.3 (CentOS)
Expires: Fri, 24 Aug 2018 00:20:48 GMT
Cache-Control: max-age=315360000000
Cache-Control: private
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/css;charset=UTF-8
{code}

Now, we have another request on /wiki, so both cookies match, and both JSESSIONIDs are returned. I have no idea how tomcat parses this, but I would say that any deviation in it's current behavior would lead to unexpected results.
fields.summary: Confluence reissues JSESSIONID, possibly conflicts with root JSESSIONID

fields.description:
In Studio, the 'Wiki' header links to '/wiki'. This then requires a round-trip as Confluence redirect the user to '/wiki/dashboard.action'.  We should link directly to '/wiki/dashboard.action'. From Australia this takes the page load time from 3.3s to 1.8s.

Though, this only benefits the case when a project hasn't yet been selected, so not a huge gain.
fields.summary: Links to apps should contain full path, not just /wiki, /source etc.

fields.description:
Gliffy is completely broken in Studio 1.2.3:

!brokengliffy.png!

We need to upgrade to [Gliffy 1.4.1|http://www.gliffy.com/blog/2008/08/07/gliffy-plugin-for-confluence-141-released/] to fix this.
fields.summary: Gliffy broken

fields.description: The help link icon is missing from next to Developer section on the Studio Admin page.
fields.summary: Help icon link missing on Studio Admin page

fields.description: Eric - please deploy Greenhopper on StAC prior to leaving today.
fields.summary: Install Greenhopper on StAC

fields.description: For the second time in two days, the user count has reset, and shows 2 developers and 1 collaborator,  when there are a total of 11 developers and 7 collaborators.
fields.summary: Studio Admin User Counts incorrect

fields.description: The help link icon is missing from next to Developer/Collaborator pulldown.
fields.summary: Help icon link missing on Create user page

fields.description: When selecting the look and feel colors, once you choose a color in the popup window, you cannot select another color.  You have to close the popup window and reopen to select a new color.
fields.summary: Look and Feel color can only be selected once
Redesign navbar implementation to avoid duplication of navbar html code

fields.description: see screenshot. little yellow dot missing
fields.summary: icon missing from user browser screen

fields.description: If you create a user that exists or if passwords don't match, the user is not created (correct behavior) but there is no error message explaining the failure (incorrect).
fields.summary: No error message on create user page

fields.description: The group menu pulldown on the user browser page (http://dev.jira.com/secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa) is incorrect.  This is a blocker for 1.3 release.
fields.summary: Group drop down menu text keys showing

fields.description: Please remove the two GreenHopper links from the navbar when all other links have also been removed.
fields.summary: Remove GreenHopper links when on non-project page

fields.description: When a new user is created, they are automatically added ott he users group but not the developers group. If the user is created as a developer rather than a collaborator, they should be automatically added to the developers group (as well as the users group). If the developers group does not exist (for example, if the customer has deleted it and uses some other group name), then user creation should still succeed, but without adding the user to the group.
fields.summary: Licensed developers should be in the regular developers group by default

fields.description:
Requesting a user activity stream is now a good deal faster (thanks to fixing AOD-996), but still can be slower than most users are willing to wait. Eg. this takes over a minute:

$ time curl -u sysadmin:$PASSWORD 'http://localhost/wiki/plugins/servlet/activityFeed?numEntries=10&username=$USER&os_authType=basic' > /tmp/out.xml
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100  1428  100  1428    0     0     21      0  0:01:08  0:01:06  0:00:02   351

real    1m6.128s
user    0m0.000s
sys     0m0.000s
$ ls -l /tmp/out.xml
-rw-rw-r-- 1 atlassian atlassian 1428 Aug 20 21:46 /tmp/out.xml
fields.summary: User activity feed still slow

fields.description:
Some customers wish to be able to write ad-hoc SQL reports against the JIRA database (eg. for timesheets). The best way to enable this is by establishing a DataSource in Confluence for JIRA, and then enabling the SQL and Run plugins.

*Resolution*

_Atlassian do not plan to address this feature as it poses a massive security thread to the entire Atlassian Cloud platform._
_Thanks for your understanding._
fields.summary: Provide SQL macro access to the JIRA database for reports

fields.description: change page title to JIRA Studio in all apps
fields.summary: change page title to JIRA Studio in all apps

fields.description: change browser icon to studio logo in all apps
fields.summary: change browser icon to studio logo in all apps

fields.description: Now 1.2.3 is on StAC what are the remaining issues to recrowdifying the instance to put an end to tickets like this https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/ADM-2116
fields.summary: Please crowdify studio.atlassian.com

fields.description: default to certain common tasks eg "create issue". Customers can modify on a user-by-user  basis.
fields.summary: user-configurable quick links drop-down

fields.description: instead trim
fields.summary: do not expand stream for wide images or long text strings

fields.description:
I think users should be able to create a new issue from anywhere within studio. Right now to create a issue from outside Jira user needs 4 clicks (Jira tab, create issue link, choose issue type and project, fill details and submit). 

Maybe having universal "Create..." menu with submenus "Issue, Page, Review" would be nice
fields.summary: Create Issue should be accessible from any application

fields.description:
Search button is broken in Confluence, see screenshot

Also searching will duplicate search term:
* type "slow" in search box, and choose wiki
* press enter
* press "Search button" - search field will be "slow, slow" (see screenshot)
fields.summary: Broken search UI in confluence

fields.description: New in 1.2.3: the activity stream does not pick up attachments added to Confluence pages. See http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/STRM-137
fields.summary: Stream does not pick up new Confluence attachments

fields.description: Activity items are being grouped into incorrect timeslots. See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-156 for details.
fields.summary: Activity stream not listing events in chronological order

fields.description: The activity stream is displaying comments in the wrong activity item. See http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/STRM-138 for details.
fields.summary: Activity stream displays comments in the wrong activity

fields.description: We need to upgrade to Atlassian Extras 2.0 rc3 (and eventually, 2.0 final).  In order for this to be done, all Studio development licenses must be updated, and anything relying on hamsAccountId needs to be updated to use the new built in license property.
fields.summary: Atlassian Extras 2.0 upgrade

fields.description: In order to be compatible with Atlassian Extras 2.0, revision 52270 needs to be back ported into JIRA 3.12.3-studio branch.  This needs to be tested and a new JIRA release needs to be cut, and Studio updated to use this release.
fields.summary: Backport JIRA license storage fix into JIRA 3.12.3-studio branch

fields.description:
In the quick search bar, enter "foo\" and search. JIRA and Fisheye return "There was a communication problem.", and in the log there is an ERROR:

{noformat}
 2008-08-13 22:31:57,712 SearchAggregator:16 ERROR [sal.jira.search.JiraSearchProvider] Error executing search
 com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchException: org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException: Cannot parse 'foo\': Lexical error at line 1, column 5.  Encountered: <EOF> after : ""
       at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.util.LuceneQueryCreator.getQueryFromSearchRequest(LuceneQueryCreator.java:193)
       at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getHits(LuceneSearchProvider.java:67)
       at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:208)
       at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:202)
       at com.atlassian.sal.jira.search.JiraSearchProvider.performSearch(JiraSearchProvider.java:118)
       at com.atlassian.sal.jira.search.JiraSearchProvider.search(JiraSearchProvider.java:106)
       at com.atlassian.studio.search.DefaultSearchAggregator$1.call(DefaultSearchAggregator.java:73)
       at com.atlassian.studio.search.DefaultSearchAggregator$1.call(DefaultSearchAggregator.java:69)
       at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:269)
       at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:123)
       at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:650)
       at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:675)
       at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
 Caused by: org.apache.lucene.queryParser.ParseException: Cannot parse 'foo\': Lexical error at line 1, column 5.  Encountered: <EOF> after : ""
       at org.apache.lucene.queryParser.QueryParser.parse(QueryParser.java:153)
       at org.apache.lucene.queryParser.MultiFieldQueryParser.parse(MultiFieldQueryParser.java:253)
       at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.parameters.lucene.util.QueryForCommentsCreator.createTextQuery(QueryForCommentsCreator.java:125)
       at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.parameters.lucene.MultipleFieldSingleValueLuceneParameter.getIssueQuery(MultipleFieldSingleValueLuceneParameter.java:81)
       at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.util.LuceneQueryCreator.getQueryFromSearchRequest(LuceneQueryCreator.java:115)
       ... 12 more
{noformat}

JIRA's native search returns the proper error, "Could not parse the query text.". Studio should be passing through the real error message, and shouldn't be throwing an ERROR (a system failure) when the problem is merely one of bad input.
fields.summary: Poor error reporting when unparseable string searched for

fields.summary: Title duplicate on 1.2.3-rc-1

fields.description: We occasionally need a place to let customers upload files, like Subversion dumps.  The simplest solution is to add a webdav directory to Studio, which would be protected by the usual Crowd authentication.
fields.summary: Add WebDAV directory to Studio

fields.description: SVN perms can be managed on a project by project basis, yet there is no way to configure the global defaults other than manually modifying the authz file. Lets add in a UI for that at the global svn project manager level.
fields.summary: Allow global svn manager defaults to be managed via UI

fields.description: Add 'Allow Anonymous Access' toggle for SVN repo manager, in the form of a checkbox on the repo manager screen. Checking this should also allow anon access in FE.
fields.summary: Add 'Allow Anonymous Access' toggle for SVN repo manager

fields.description: Added a Test page on WIki - could not save the edited page (only the title saved).  Also, the tabs to switch between Rich Text and Wiki Markup did not function.
fields.summary: Cannot Edit page on Wiki

fields.description:
We and Contegix occasionally get spammed with unwanted email notifications from Studio instances. This is because our administrative users (admin and contegix) are in all groups, including 'administrators' and 'developers', and many customers configure Studio to send JIRA notification emails to all 'developers'.

We should modify our clean Studio deployment to only be in 'users', 'administrators' and 'system-administrators'.
fields.summary: Remove admin and contegix users from the developers, administrators groups

fields.description:
For instance, viewing Don's profile:

https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dbrown

The activity stream takes up to 75s to return.

For one customer, the logs show a particular user's activity stream regularly taking 69 minutes to return. Something is very broken.
fields.summary: User activity feed is unusably slow
Spec out Crowd:Crowd connector

fields.description:
Our Studio fireball currently ships with a log4j configuration file in each product that will email any warnings or errors to studio-logging@atlassian.com.

Given that the Studio fireball is publicly available, it can't be that long before someone somewhere is going to get curious and try to install it.  When they do, if there is a mail server on the host they install it on, and they don't change the logging configuration, our sysadmins will get spammed.
fields.summary: Sysadmins will be spammed if anyone tries to install Studio fireball

fields.description:
When you are on the source tab the title of the page is "Crucible 1.5"
These should proabbly be swapped, or both made to say "JIRA Studio 3.1.4.15.9".
fields.summary: FishEye and Crucible titles are swapped

fields.description:
After creating an applink, and clicking "Synchronize", a REST call is made that may or may not succeed.  Often it doesn't, eg. if something prevented the trusted apps link from being established.  Yet the web interface reports "Application was successfully synchronized." regardless.

In EditInstances.java#doSynchronize, we should not be just ignore the response code from the REST call. If we get back a 401, the returned error message should be displayed.
fields.summary: Applink synchronization does not report errors, and instead says it succeeded

fields.description:
If you:
 - Create a project
 - Edit its "Subversion Repository" link, and set it to None
 - Delete the project.

The delete fails, with:

{noformat}
Cause:
java.lang.NullPointerException

Stack Trace: [hide]

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.studio.project.deleter.SvnRepositoryDeleter.doOperation(SvnRepositoryDeleter.java:131)
	at com.atlassian.studio.bc.DefaultStudioProjectService.performProjectOperations(DefaultStudioProjectService.java:143)
	at com.atlassian.studio.bc.DefaultStudioProjectService.performOperations(DefaultStudioProjectService.java:134)
	at com.atlassian.studio.bc.DefaultStudioProjectService.delete(DefaultStudioProjectService.java:74)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.project.DeleteStudioProject.doExecute(DeleteStudioProject.java:80)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
{noformat}

Our code assumes that the various project links are always present, which may not be the case.
fields.summary: Deleting a project fails if no Subversion link is configured

fields.description:
Activity Stream from Crucible broken on dev.jira.com  -- 

2008-08-06 20:39:25,043 TP-Processor12 WARN [atlassian.studio.streams.DefaultActivityFeedManager] Error getting activity from Crucible
2008-08-06 20:39:25.044874500 java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 500 for URL: https://dev.jira.com/source/plugins/servlet/activityFeed?numEntries=20

We cannot release 1.2.3 until this is fixed.
fields.summary: Activity Stream Broken

fields.summary: SSO Broken

set navbar colors
logout

fields.summary: Studio Favorites

fields.description: Sign in as an Administrator/Collaborator.  Can get access to JIRA admin page.  Click link to Wiki Admin page, and access is denied.  Administrator/Developer has access to Wiki Admin.
fields.summary: Unable to acess Wiki Administration as Collaborator/Admin

fields.description: The Atlassian To field for the user counter plugin has the description for the Atlassian From field, and vice versa.
fields.summary: To and From keys and descriptions are mixed up for user counter plugin

fields.description:
Instead of JIRA history and Confluence history, add a single global history.

developer to work with MK on spec.
fields.summary: Add Global History

fields.description: The FishEye navbar username is not escaped.  This is not an XSS vulnerability as the only people that can change the full name are administrators and the user themselves, and the only person that sees the username in the FishEye navbar is the user, so the user can only exploit it to XSS attack themselves.
fields.summary: FishEye navbar user full name is not escaped

fields.description: Make sure to upgrade crowd-integration-client to 1.4.4 (or 1.4.5)
fields.summary: Upgrade Crucible/Fisheye to 1.5.4

fields.description: When a collaborator hacks the URL (or tries to follow link in Activity Stream) to get to Source or Review tabs - show Not Authorized page (to be provided) rather than Login page.  Do not log collaborator out of system when going to these tabs, just block access to URL.
fields.summary: Don't show login page for Source/Review tabs for Collaborators

fields.description: Possibly because there is a <html> tag in the vm template.
fields.summary: create user screen breaks sitemesh and everythin goes away (css, admin menu, navbar, etc)

fields.description: All the rewritten JSPs for user administration need to have all variable references URL encoded or HTML encoded to prevent XSS and URL encoding issues.
fields.summary: Prevent XSS attacks and encoding issues

fields.description: Upgrade Studio 1.2.3 and above to Confluence 2.9 (release date Aug 6th).
fields.summary: Upgrade to Confluence 2.9

Right now they're off. Lets turn on.

wiki/admin/viewgeneralconfig.action

Threaded Comments = ON
fields.summary: Enable threaded comments by default in Confluence

fields.summary: Disable specifying account type for StAC

fields.description: Use the new property in studio.properties.
fields.summary: Disable license upgrade task for StAC

fields.description:
This should use a new property in studio.properties to determine if source and review tabs should be hidden.  Suggested property name is "studio.external.crowd".

I don't think this can be tested, unless there is a way to dynamically reload studio.properties.
fields.summary: Ensure source and review tabs aren't hidden on StAC
Move studio.properties file into studio home directory

fields.description: Bundle "Terms of Use", "Privacy Policy" and "Security Statement" into the one page so as to reduce the number of links - provide more focus.
fields.summary: Consolidate Footer Links

fields.description: Change all #3c78b5 to #6a8eb3 in the CSS. This should fix most of the problems. Go through the product to find any others.
fields.summary: Inconsistent colour schemes

fields.description:
I need half a day to work some code that was reviewed into Bonnie's trunk so we can take advantage of it in the future.
https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/cru/CR-868#c3393

This is related to wiki rendering when previewing an issue that is currently being created (e.g. when on the 'create issue' page).
fields.summary: Time for Bonnie

fields.description:
If you make changes to tegh user's email or name in the user profile page, they are not saved.
I discovered this while working on AOD-925, but after backing out my changes this issue still appears. I suspect it is related to saving data back to crowd. It may be a caching issue.

example url:
http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/admin/user/EditUser!default.jspa?editName=collaborator
fields.summary: Studio edit user profile page is broken

fields.description:
Email Contegix with the appropriate instructions for the changes necessitated by licensing project. (Can just point them to release notes).  Ensure Contegix understands the changes are for 1.3.

Update Studio 1.3 release notes with same instructions.

Update ReadMe file with same same instructions.
fields.summary: Email Contegix with new build instructions

fields.description:
As currently implemented, StAC will break due to the license changes. The 3 areas that will be broken are:

* Upgrade task to create new group and assign users to it will fail
* Navbar won't display source and review tabs because no users will be in the developer group
* User creation/modification will fail because developer group does not exist

The last point is probably irrelavant because you can't edit users on StAC anyway.

It would be good if the solution to this problem will also help solve future StAC problems as well. We should also take into consideration the fact that other instances with external crowds will also face this problem.

One possible solution is to say if user management is disabled in jira, then the source and review tabs should not be hidden.
fields.summary: Ensure licensing changes won't break StAC

fields.description:
Changing colors of navbar needs better caching. 
Implementation caches CSS file based on ETag which makes browser send a new request every time user access the page. Caching should be improved to cache CSS files forever and change urls when user change the colors.
fields.summary: Improve CSS caching mechanism
Implement L&F customisation

fields.description:
To clarify, here's a sample process:

* customer searches Studio using Studio search box in navbar
* results page defaults to all projects
* clicking on the source results link takes you to studio search results page with only source results showing (because FE doesn't have global search)
* selecting a specific project to search, then searching again gives you results for that specific project in FE
* clicking on the 'more' link from here now takes you into FE's search screen
* however, it takes you into the simple FE search screen, not the advanced search screen
* this link should instead take you into the FE advanced search screen
fields.summary: Studio search - send FishEye search results link to advanced search page, not simple

fields.description:
As part of this, make sure all new plugins for 2.9 are installed, enabled, and working.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+2.9+Release+Notes
fields.summary: Confluence 2.9 upgrade

fields.description: See screenshot. Please make sure that search trims results at some reasonable number of digits.
fields.summary: Search not trimming results?

fields.description: Allow project home page to be set on a project by project basis by administrator. Allow them to enter a url for home page (will allow them to specify a wiki page etc.)
fields.summary: Allow project home page to be set on a project by project basis

fields.description: When first entering Studio, the default messages "You have no..." are very wordy, hard to scan and create additional visual noise.  Cut back on the copy. Get technical writing to help with this.
fields.summary: Create new default message for Studio.

fields.description:
Remove search link on Reviews from the sub-nav bar.  Then reorder remaining links to be 'Dashboard' 'Create new review'

Remove search link on Source from the sub-nav bar.  Then reorder remaining links to be 'Browse' 'Change log'
fields.summary: Remove search link on Source & Reviews

fields.description:
I'm installing test instances of JIRA and Confluence at:
http://applinks-test.atlassian.com/jira
http://applinks-test.atlassian.com/confluence

As a sanity check, would like to install applinks and stream fresh using the source and documentation we've published. 
* Make sure installation occurs with no issues. 
* Make sure configuration matches documentation.
* Make sure linking works in both Confluence and JIRA
* Make sure Streams is able to pull in data from Confluence and JIRA
fields.summary: Test applinks & stream installation/configuration/functionality against live instances

fields.description: Use of icons within the drop down menu is not duplicated in the tabs and therefore useless as a visual cue.   Instead of using icons in the drop-down, use words (like MySpace).
fields.summary: Instead of using icons in the search drop-down, use words

fields.description: Activity Stream displays projects as codes. This means the user has to remember the codes. Change codes to full project names..
fields.summary: Change all codes to the project name

fields.description: Remove the Logo URL input field from the EditStudioLogo!default.jspa.  The Edit Studio Logo section of the page should contain only the logo upload box.
fields.summary: Remove Logo URL from edit logo page

fields.description:
Tracking issue for Usability changes suggested by Design;

http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/D/Usability+Targets
fields.summary: Umbrella task for Usability Issues

fields.description: Give customers the ability to add their own tabs and enter a URL. Clicking on the tab takes you to that url in a frame, keeps tabs at top in separate frame. Kinda like the way google image search leaves the section at the top when you visit a search result page. Use case - forums, or bamboo, or any other application a customer would want to have "integrated" into the suite.
fields.summary: ability for customers to add configurable tabs

fields.description:
!rollover.png!

As you can see, the rollover goes above the 2nd bar.

This happens in FF2 on a windows system.
fields.summary: Local action link rollover - 1px high

fields.description:
A few final steps needed before we release AppLinks: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEVNET/Atlassian+Supported+Plugins

    * be available in Developer Network SVN.
    * have its dependencies in the Developer Maven Repository.
    * have a JIRA project.
    * have a Bamboo Project.
    * be in the plugin repository (For Confluence).
    * have unit and functional tests with a certain amount of code-coverage.
    * have complete, accurate and attractive documentation on Confluence.
    * display a compatibility matrix for the last three product releases.
    * be internationalized.
fields.summary: final tasks for AppLinks release - make 'supported'

fields.description: Disable the source and review tabs so that people without a developer license can't see them.
fields.summary: Disable tabs for non-developers

fields.description: Create upgrade task to create a special developer group and put all users into that group.

Determine new License Format

License will contain information about user counts for both types of users
